cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 640 mi SW of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to curve northwest on Friday, then turn north Saturday night and north-northeast toward the northern Baja California Peninsula and the Southwest U.S. early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Baja California Peninsula (near central/northern coast)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells impacting southwestern Mexico, southern Baja California, and the southern California coastline
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Monday–Tuesday with only a 6% cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds; tropical-storm-force winds are not expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-period swell will bring elevated surf and dangerous rip currents; surge >3 ft not expected inside the bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Rosa could bring periods of heavy rain Monday–Tuesday with localized 1–2 in totals and minor flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, rip currents, and possible minor coastal flooding could disrupt small-craft and berth operations.
